parameters.content:
# ‚ö†Ô∏è ADVANCED USE ONLY

### üö® This workflow is for advanced users only!

This MCP server contains **47 operations** which is significantly more than the recommended maximum of 40 tools for most AI clients.

### üîç Recommended Alternative
**Seek a simplified MCP server** that utilizes the official n8n tool implementation for api.video if available, as it will be more efficient and easier to manage.

### üõ†Ô∏è Advanced Usage Instructions

**BEFORE adding this MCP server to your client:**
### Disable or delete unused nodes - Review sections and disable/delete those you don't need

**AFTER adding the MCP server to your client:**
1.**Selective tool enabling** - Instead of enabling all tools (default), manually select only the specific tools you need for *that* Workflow's MCP client.
2. **Monitor performance** - Too many tools can slow down AI responses

### üí° Pro Tips
**Keep maximum 40 enabled tools** - Most AI clients perform better with fewer tools
- Group related operations and only enable one group at a time
- Use the overview note to understand what each operation group does
- Consider creating multiple smaller MCP servers for different use cases

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions

1. **Import Workflow**: 
Load this workflow into your n8n instance

2. **Authentication**: 
No authentication required

3. **Activate Workflow**:
Enable the workflow to start the MCP server

4. **Get MCP URL**: 
Copy the webhook URL from the MCP trigger

5. **Connect AI Agent**:
Use the MCP URL in your AI agent configuration


### üí° Usage Notes
‚Ä¢ Parameters are auto-populated by AI using $fromAI() expressions
‚Ä¢ With 47 API endpoints available as tools
‚Ä¢ Responses maintain original API structure


### üõ†Ô∏è Customization
‚Ä¢ Add data transformation nodes if needed
‚Ä¢ Implement custom error handling
‚Ä¢ Add logging or monitoring nodes

‚Ä¢ Modify parameter defaults in any HTTP request node as needed

### üí¨ Need Help?
Ping me on [discord](https://discord.me/cfomodz) for integration guidance and custom automations. Check the [n8n documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/sub-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.toolmcp/) for more information.

## üõ†Ô∏è api.video MCP Server ‚úÖ 47 operations

### About
api.video is an API that encodes on the go to facilitate immediate playback, enhancing viewer streaming experiences across multiple devices and platforms. You can stream live or on-demand online videos within minutes.

### üîß How it Works

This workflow converts the api.video API into an MCP-compatible interface for AI agents.

‚Ä¢ **MCP Trigger**: Serves as your server endpoint for AI agent requests
‚Ä¢ **HTTP Request Nodes**: Handle API calls to https://ws.api.video
‚Ä¢ **AI Expressions**: Automatically populate parameters via `$fromAI()` placeholders
‚Ä¢ **Native Integration**: Returns responses directly to the AI agent


### üìã Available Operations (47 endpoints)

**Account (1 operations)**
show

**Analytics (3 operations)**
list

**Authentication (2 operations)**
authenticate, refresh

**Live (7 operations)**
list, create, delete, show, update, upload

**Players (7 operations)**
list, create, delete, show, update, upload

**Videos - Delegated Upload (5 operations)**
upload, list, generate, delete, show

**Videos (9 operations)**
list, create, delete, show, update, upload, pick

**Captions (5 operations)**
list, delete, show, update, upload

**Chapters (4 operations)**
list, delete, show, upload

**Web Hooks (4 operations)**
list, create, delete, show

parameters.url: =https://ws.api.video/account
parameters.toolDescription: Show account

parameters.url: =https://ws.api.video/analytics/live-streams/{{ $fromAI('liveStreamId', 'The unique identifier for the live stream you want to retrieve analytics for.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: period
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('period', 'Period must have one of the following formats: - For a day : "2018-01-01", - For a week: "2018-W01", - For a month: "2018-01" - For a year: "2018" For a range period: - Date range: "2018-01-01/2018-01-15"', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
List live stream player sessions

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ liveStreamId (required) - The unique identifier for the live stream you want to retrieve analytics for.
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ period (optional) - Period must have one of the following formats: - For a day : "2018-01-01", - For a week: "2018-W01", - For a month: "2018-01" - For a year: "2018" For a range period: - Date range: "2018-01-01/2018-01-15"

parameters.url: =https://ws.api.video/analytics/sessions/{{ $fromAI('sessionId', 'A unique identifier you can use to reference and track a session with.', 'string') }}/events
parameters.toolDescription:
List player session events

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ sessionId (required) - A unique identifier you can use to reference and track a session with.

parameters.url: =https://ws.api.video/analytics/videos/{{ $fromAI('videoId', 'The unique identifier for the video you want to retrieve session information for.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: period
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('period', 'Period must have one of the following formats: - For a day : 2018-01-01, - For a week: 2018-W01, - For a month: 2018-01 - For a year: 2018 For a range period: - Date range: 2018-01-01/2018-01-15', 'string') }}

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('metadata', 'Metadata and [Dynamic Metadata](https://api.video/blog/endpoints/dynamic-metadata) filter. Send an array of key value pairs you want to filter sessios with.', 'json') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
List video player sessions

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ videoId (required) - The unique identifier for the video you want to retrieve session information for.
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ period (optional) - Period must have one of the following formats: - For a day : 2018-01-01, - For a week: 2018-W01, - For a month: 2018-01 - For a year: 2018 For a range period: - Date range: 2018-01-01/2018-01-15
  ‚Ä¢ metadata (optional) - Metadata and [Dynamic Metadata](https://api.video/blog/endpoints/dynamic-metadata) filter. Send an array of key value pairs you want to filter sessios with.

parameters.toolDescription: Authenticate

parameters.url: =https://ws.api.video/auth/refresh
parameters.toolDescription: Refresh token

parameters.url: =https://ws.api.video/live-streams

parameters.name: streamKey
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('streamKey', 'The unique stream key that allows you to stream videos.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: name
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('name', 'You can filter live streams by their name or a part of their name.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('sortBy', 'Allowed: createdAt, publishedAt, name. createdAt - the time a livestream was created using the specified streamKey. publishedAt - the time a livestream was published using the specified streamKey. name - the name of the livestream. If you choose one of the time based options, the time is presented in ISO-8601 format.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('sortOrder', 'Allowed: asc, desc. Ascending for date and time means that earlier values precede later ones. Descending means that later values preced earlier ones. For title, it is 0-9 and A-Z ascending and Z-A, 9-0 descending.', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
List all live streams

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ streamKey (optional) - The unique stream key that allows you to stream videos.
  ‚Ä¢ name (optional) - You can filter live streams by their name or a part of their name.
  ‚Ä¢ sortBy (optional) - Allowed: createdAt, publishedAt, name. createdAt - the time a livestream was created using the specified streamKey. publishedAt - the time a livestream was published using the specified streamKey. name - the name of the livestream. If you choose one of the time based options, the time is presented in ISO-8601 format.
  ‚Ä¢ sortOrder (optional) - Allowed: asc, desc. Ascending for date and time means that earlier values precede later ones. Descending means that later values preced earlier ones. For title, it is 0-9 and A-Z ascending and Z-A, 9-0 descending.

parameters.url: =https://ws.api.video/upload

parameters.name: token
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('token', 'The unique identifier for the token you want to use to upload a video.', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
Upload with an upload token

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ token (required) - The unique identifier for the token you want to use to upload a video.
- Header parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ Content-Range (optional) - Content-Range represents the range of bytes that will be returned as a result of the request. Byte ranges are inclusive, meaning that bytes 0-999 represents the first 1000 bytes in a file or object.

parameters.name: Content-Range
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('Content-Range', 'Content-Range represents the range of bytes that will be returned as a result of the request. Byte ranges are inclusive, meaning that bytes 0-999 represents the first 1000 bytes in a file or object.', 'string') }}

parameters.url: =https://ws.api.video/upload-tokens

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('sortBy', 'Allowed: createdAt, ttl. You can use these to sort by when a token was created, or how much longer the token will be active (ttl - time to live). Date and time is presented in ISO-8601 format.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('sortOrder', 'Allowed: asc, desc. Ascending is 0-9 or A-Z. Descending is 9-0 or Z-A.', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
List all active upload tokens.

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ sortBy (optional) - Allowed: createdAt, ttl. You can use these to sort by when a token was created, or how much longer the token will be active (ttl - time to live). Date and time is presented in ISO-8601 format.
  ‚Ä¢ sortOrder (optional) - Allowed: asc, desc. Ascending is 0-9 or A-Z. Descending is 9-0 or Z-A.

Delete an upload token

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ uploadToken (required) - The unique identifier for the upload token you want to delete. Deleting a token will make it so the token can no longer be used for authentication.

parameters.toolDescription:
Show upload token

Parameters:

parameters.url: =https://ws.api.video/videos

parameters.name: title
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('title', 'The title of a specific video you want to find. The search will match exactly to what term you provide and return any videos that contain the same term as part of their titles.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: tags
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('tags', 'A tag is a category you create and apply to videos. You can search for videos with particular tags by listing one or more here. Only videos that have all the tags you list will be returned.', 'json') }}

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('metadata', 'Videos can be tagged with metadata tags in key:value pairs. You can search for videos with specific key value pairs using this parameter. [Dynamic Metadata](https://api.video/blog/endpoints/dynamic-metadata) allows you to define a key that allows any value pair.', 'json') }}

parameters.name: description
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('description', 'If you described a video with a term or sentence, you can add it here to return videos containing this string.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: liveStreamId
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('liveStreamId', 'If you know the ID for a live stream, you can retrieve the stream by adding the ID for it here.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('sortBy', 'Allowed: publishedAt, title. You can search by the time videos were published at, or by title.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('sortOrder', 'Allowed: asc, desc. asc is ascending and sorts from A to Z. desc is descending and sorts from Z to A.', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
List all videos

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ title (optional) - The title of a specific video you want to find. The search will match exactly to what term you provide and return any videos that contain the same term as part of their titles.
  ‚Ä¢ tags (optional) - A tag is a category you create and apply to videos. You can search for videos with particular tags by listing one or more here. Only videos that have all the tags you list will be returned.
  ‚Ä¢ metadata (optional) - Videos can be tagged with metadata tags in key:value pairs. You can search for videos with specific key value pairs using this parameter. [Dynamic Metadata](https://api.video/blog/endpoints/dynamic-metadata) allows you to define a key that allows any value pair.
  ‚Ä¢ description (optional) - If you described a video with a term or sentence, you can add it here to return videos containing this string.
  ‚Ä¢ liveStreamId (optional) - If you know the ID for a live stream, you can retrieve the stream by adding the ID for it here.
  ‚Ä¢ sortBy (optional) - Allowed: publishedAt, title. You can search by the time videos were published at, or by title.
  ‚Ä¢ sortOrder (optional) - Allowed: asc, desc. asc is ascending and sorts from A to Z. desc is descending and sorts from Z to A.
